intro: Hapaline, commonly known as the water lily, is a aquatic plant belonging to the family Nymphaeaceae. It is characterized by its broad, floating leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom above the water surface. The plant has a rhizomatous root system that anchors it in shallow water or muddy substrates. Hapaline plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for various aquatic organisms. Its presence often indicates good water quality due to its sensitivity to pollution.
